item.title: 沃尔沃出人意料地更换首席执行官，回归汽车行业的基本原理
item.description: 分析师和投资者表示，沃尔沃汽车公司突然决定聘请哈坎-塞缪尔森（Hakan Samuelsson）担任首席执行官，这使这位汽车行业的资深人士重新掌管沃尔沃汽车公司，带领该公司渡过美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税动荡和向电动汽车转型的艰难时期。【原文：Volvo Car's abrupt decision to tap Hakan Samuelsson as its CEO puts the car industry veteran back in charge of steering the automaker through U.S. President Donald Trump's tariff turbulence and a wobbly transition to electric cars, analysts and investors said.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会关注 23andMe 破产案中的隐私保护问题
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会主席周一表示，该机构对最近申请破产的 23andMe 祖先测试公司可能出售或转让美国人个人信息的行为表示担忧。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission is concerned about the potential sale or transfer of Americans' personal information by 23andMe ancestry testing company that recently filed for bankruptcy, the agency's chairman said on Monday.】

item.title: 工会起诉阻止特朗普终止许多联邦工作人员的集体谈判
item.description: 代表 15 万名美国政府雇员的工会周一提起诉讼，寻求阻止唐纳德-特朗普总统剥夺数十万联邦工作人员通过工会与政府机构进行集体谈判的能力。【原文：A union that represents 150,000 U.S. government employees filed a lawsuit on Monday seeking to block President Donald Trump from stripping hundreds of thousands of federal workers of the ability to collectively bargain with government agencies through their unions.】

item.title: 美国喷气燃料油轮运营商因碰撞事故在英国提起诉讼
item.description: 上个月，一艘美国军方承包的油轮在英格兰东北海岸附近被一艘货轮撞击，该油轮的管理者周一就撞击事件向伦敦高等法院提起诉讼。【原文：The manager of a U.S. military-contracted tanker that was struck by a cargo ship off England's northeast coast last month filed a lawsuit at London's High Court on Monday over the collision.】

item.title: 即使经济前景有所改善，受贫困影响的阿根廷人仍在寻找食物
item.description: 在自由主义总统哈维尔-米莱伊的领导下，阿根廷实施了严厉的财政紧缩政策，一些阿根廷人正在四处觅食，从事更多非正式的低薪工作，尽管随着通胀降温，最痛苦的时期可能已经过去的希望正在升温。【原文：Some Argentines, hit by tough austerity under libertarian President Javier Milei, are rummaging for food and taking on more informal low-salary jobs, even as hope rises that the most painful period may be over as inflation cools.】

item.title: 中国国营媒体称中日韩将联合应对美国关税
item.description: 中国国家广播公司中央电视台下属的一个社交媒体账户周一称，中国、日本和韩国同意共同应对美国的关税。【原文：China, Japan and South Korea agreed to jointly respond to U.S. tariffs, a social media account affiliated with Chinese state broadcaster CCTV said on Monday.】

item.title: 据《日经新闻》报道，GlobalFoundries 和台湾芯片制造商联电正在酝酿潜在合并
item.description: 据《日经新闻》（Nikkei）周一援引该报看到的一份评估计划报道，台湾主要芯片制造商联华电子（United Microelectronics）和美国环球晶圆厂（GlobalFoundries）正在探讨合并的可能性。【原文：Taiwan's major chipmaker United Microelectronics and U.S.-based GlobalFoundries are exploring the possibility of a merger, the Nikkei reported on Monday, citing an assessment plan seen by the newspaper.】

item.title: 日本银行业游说团主席：受关税影响的企业可能需要业务转型融资
item.description: 日本银行业游说团团长表示，日本银行可能需要为受到美国总统唐纳德-特朗普政府征收关税打击的企业提供业务周转支持。【原文：Japanese banks may need to offer business turnaround support to companies hit by tariffs imposed by the administration of U.S. President Donald Trump, the head of the country's banking lobby said.】

item.title: 特斯拉在中国为新款 Model Y 提供 3 年免息贷款
item.description: 特斯拉周一在其社交媒体账户上发布公告称，该公司将于 4 月 30 日前在中国为改款 Model Y 提供为期三年的无息贷款。【原文：Tesla said on Monday the company will offer three-year interest-free loans for the refreshed Model Y before April 30 in China, a notice on its social media account showed.】

item.title: 民主党参议员敦促特朗普改革对华贸易关系，修改自由贸易协议
item.description: 三位民主党参议员周一敦促美国总统唐纳德-特朗普 "大幅修改 "美国与中国的贸易关系以及14项自由贸易协定，为他推动美国贸易政策改革提供了助力。【原文：Three Democratic senators on Monday urged U.S. President Donald Trump to "dramatically revise" the United States' trade relationship with China along with 14 free trade agreements, providing a boost to his push to revamp U.S. trade policy.】

item.title: 美国关税临近，黄金突破 3100 美元，进入未知领域
item.description: 金价飙升至每盎司 3100 美元以上的创纪录水平，这是该贵金属历史上最重要的涨势之一，心理价位被各种因素一扫而空，其中包括对美国即将征收关税的担忧。【原文：Gold prices soared to record levels above $3,100 per ounce in a rally marking one of the most significant upswings in the precious metal's history, with psychological levels swept aside by a cocktail of factors - including worry about fallout from impending U.S. tariffs.】

item.title: EIA 数据显示，1 月份美国石油产量降至 11 个月低点
item.description: 美国能源信息署周一公布的数据显示，1月份美国原油产量减少30.5万桶/日，降至1315万桶/日，为2024年2月以来最低。【原文：U.S. crude oil production fell by 305,000-barrels-per-day (bpd) to 13.15 million bpd in January, the lowest since February 2024, data from the U.S. Energy Information Administration showed on Monday.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称，Brookfield 接近以 90 多亿美元收购 Colonial 管道公司
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周一表示，布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司（Brookfield Asset Management）正在为收购美国最大的燃料运输系统殖民管道公司（Colonial Pipeline）的交易做最后的润色，包括债务在内的收购价格将超过 90 亿美元。【原文：Brookfield Asset Management is putting the final touches on a deal to acquire Colonial Pipeline, the largest U.S. fuel transportation system, for more than $9 billion including debt, people familiar with the matter said on Monday.】

item.title: 欧洲防务挑战在黑客马拉松上为青年技术人员注入活力
item.description: 周末在阿姆斯特丹举行的旨在为乌克兰寻找快速廉价战场解决方案的黑客马拉松吸引了 100 多名年轻程序员和工程师参加，其中许多人表示，欧洲的重整军备计划促使他们考虑从事国防事业。【原文：A weekend hackathon in Amsterdam aimed at finding fast-and-cheap battlefield solutions for Ukraine drew more than 100 young programmers and engineers, with many saying Europe's rearmament plans were prompting them to consider careers in defence.】

item.title: 芯片初创公司 Retym 融资 7500 万美元，打造人工智能连接数据中心的芯片
item.description: 芯片初创公司 Retym 周一表示，该公司今年已融资 7500 万美元，这是公司 1.8 亿美元融资总额的一部分，用于在数据中心开发人工智能计算所需的网络芯片。【原文：Chip startup Retym has raised $75 million this year as part of $180 million in total funding the company is using to pursue networking chips for artificial intelligence computing in data centers, the company said on Monday.】

item.title: 德意志银行建议克尔斯蒂-罗斯和克劳斯-穆斯迈尔加入监事会
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank）周一表示，在即将于 5 月 22 日召开的年度股东大会上，Kirsty Roth 和 Klaus Moosmayer 已被提议加入德意志银行监事会。【原文：Deutsche Bank said on Monday that Kirsty Roth and Klaus Moosmayer have been proposed to join the German bank's supervisory board in a vote at the upcoming annual shareholder meeting on May 22.】

item.title: Temporal Technologies 以 17 亿美元的估值融资 1.46 亿美元
item.description: Temporal Technologies 周一表示，该公司已在投资公司 Tiger Global 的主导下融资 1.46 亿美元，软件公司估值达 17.2 亿美元。【原文：Temporal Technologies on Monday said it has raised $146 million led by investment firm Tiger Global, valuing the software firm at $1.72 billion.】

item.title: 大烟草公司瞄准特朗普，希望--也害怕--变革
item.description: 文件显示，英美烟草公司等大型烟草公司正在游说美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的政府打击非法吸食器，包括通过禁止进口中国设备。【原文：Big tobacco companies like British American Tobacco are lobbying U.S. President Donald Trump's administration to crack down on illegal vapes, including via import bans on Chinese devices, documents show and industry consultants said.】

item.title: 谷歌支持的人工智能药物发现初创公司融资 6 亿美元
item.description: Isomorphic Labs 是一家利用人工智能技术进行药物研发的初创公司，该公司周一表示，在由 Thrive Capital 领投的首轮外部融资中，已筹集到 6 亿美元。【原文：Isomorphic Labs, which uses artificial intelligence technologies for drug discovery, has raised $600 million in its first ever external funding round led by Thrive Capital, the startup said on Monday.】

item.title: 陶氏和 X-energy 公司提交德克萨斯州核项目施工许可申请
item.description: 陶氏化学公司和 X-energy Reactor 公司周一表示，已就德克萨斯州 Seadrift 的拟议核项目向核管理委员会（NRC）提交了施工许可申请。【原文：Chemical firm Dow and X-energy Reactor Company have submitted a construction permit application to the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) for a proposed nuclear project in Seadrift, Texas, the companies said on Monday.】

item.title: 丰田表示，尽管美国加征关税，但仍将维持运营
item.description: 丰田公司周一表示，将一如既往地运营其业务，并专注于降低固定成本，没有表示任何提高汽车价格以应对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普关税的意图。【原文：Toyota will keep running its operations as it has been and focus on bringing down fixed costs, it said on Monday, not expressing any intention to raise vehicle prices in response to U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs.】

item.title: 美联航首架配备星链系统的飞机获得 FAA 批准
item.description: 美国联合航空公司（United Airlines）周一表示，美国联邦航空管理局已批准其首架配备星链系统的飞机型号，并计划于 5 月份进行首次商业飞行。【原文：United Airlines said Monday the Federal Aviation Administration has approved its first Starlink-equipped aircraft type and that the first commercial flight is planned for May.】

item.title: 特朗普传媒将在纽约证券交易所德克萨斯州分部上市
item.description: Truth Social 的运营商 Trump Media & Technology Group 周一表示，公司股票将在纽约证券交易所德克萨斯分部上市。【原文：Trump Media & Technology Group , the operator of Truth Social, said on Monday it will list its shares on the New York Stock Exchange Texas.】

item.title: 森普拉公司将出售墨西哥能源资产和基础设施部门股份
item.description: 公用事业公司 Sempra 周一表示，将出售墨西哥的部分能源基础设施资产和 Sempra 基础设施公司的少数股权，以资助其 560 亿美元的五年资本支出计划。【原文：Utility firm Sempra will sell some energy infrastructure assets in Mexico and a minority stake in Sempra Infrastructure to fund its five-year capex plan of $56 billion, it said on Monday.】

item.title: 消息人士称德国 DHL 将收购美国医药物流公司 Cryopdp
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的消息人士周一透露，DHL 将以三位数百万欧元的价格收购美国医药物流公司 Cryopdp，作为这家德国公司在医药领域扩张的一部分。【原文：DHL is set to acquire U.S. pharmaceutical logistics firm Cryopdp for a three-digit million-euro sum as part of the German company's efforts to expand in the pharma sector, a source familiar with the matter said on Monday.】

item.title: 首相发言人称，英国预计本周将受到美国关税的冲击
item.description: 英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）的发言人周一表示，英国预计本周将受到美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收全球关税计划的冲击，政府已经为所有可能发生的情况做好了准备。【原文：Britain expects to be hit by U.S. President Donald Trump's plans to impose global tariffs this week and the government has been preparing for all eventualities, Prime Minister Keir Starmer's spokesman said on Monday.】

item.title: 贝莱德首席执行官芬克警告 "保护主义 "卷土重来
item.description: 就在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普即将对全球经济征收新一轮关税的前几天，贝莱德首席执行官拉里-芬克（Larry Fink）告诉投资者，"保护主义已经强势回归"。【原文：BlackRock chief executive Larry Fink has told investors that "protectionism has returned with force" just days before a fresh round of tariffs from U.S. President Donald Trump are set to be unleashed on the global economy.】

item.title: Hut 8, 埃里克-特朗普将成立比特币矿业公司
item.description: Hut 8 公司周一表示，它已与唐纳德-特朗普总统的儿子埃里克-特朗普联手创办了一家名为 American Bitcoin 的比特币矿业公司。【原文：Hut 8 said on Monday it had joined hands with President Donald Trump's son, Eric Trump, to launch a bitcoin mining company called American Bitcoin.】

item.title: Rocket Companies 将以 94 亿美元收购库珀先生集团
item.description: Rocket Companies 周一表示，它将以 94 亿美元的全股票交易价格收购库珀先生集团。【原文：Rocket Companies said on Monday it would buy Mr Cooper Group for $9.4 billion in an all-stock transaction.】

item.title: 有报道称美国食品及药物管理局最高疫苗监管者将离职，导致生物技术股暴跌
item.description: 据报道，美国食品和药物管理局（Food and Drug Administration）疫苗部门的一位高级官员已经辞职，这加剧了人们对突破性疗法审查速度放缓的担忧，美国生物技术公司的股价在周一盘前下跌了10%之多。【原文：Shares of U.S. biotech companies fell as much as 10% premarket on Monday following reports that a top vaccine official at the U.S. Food and Drug Administration had resigned, fanning worries over slower reviews for breakthrough treatments.】
